section: i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance at its convenience, without prior notice.
explanation: This statement grants i-on the ability to perform maintenance without any prior notification. This can be considered a discrepancy because a customer would expect to be notified of any maintenance that may be performed on their website. Most hosting providers allow customers to know when they are going to conduct any maintenance on the site, this is not in place. This is an in-text contradiction.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees within 30 days of receiving the invoice. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner may result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The contract specifies that the customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee of $450 and must pay within 30 days of receiving the invoice, or the service may be interrupted. This is a discrepancy because it is not clear what the terms are if a service is discontinued or interuppted. There should be a section in the contract stating the procedure in a situation like this. This is a legal contradiction.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: The term and termination conditions present a contradiction. It states that the agreement automatically renews for one-month periods unless a 15-day notice is given. However, it also states that either party can terminate the agreement at any time with a 30-day notice. This discrepancy arises because the 15-day notice for non-renewal clashes with the 30-day notice for termination. If a party gives a 20-day notice, is that considered a non-renewal or termination?
